macro_definition.first_error_rule: The first error is the earliest MAJOR claim, theorem, or numbered statement whose conclusion is not sufficiently supported by previous statements, accepting all author assumptions.

rules: Do not classify philosophical disagreement as an error.

error_codes.name: Missing dependency
error_codes.description: A claim uses a result, definition, or assumption that has not been established earlier.

error_codes.name: Non-sequitur step
error_codes.description: The conclusion does not logically follow from previous statements.

error_codes.name: Quantifier or scope shift
error_codes.description: Changes meaning between existence/universality, finite/asymptotic, or instance/general case.

error_codes.name: Complexity-class misuse
error_codes.description: Incorrect reasoning about complexity classes or reductions (e.g., NP-complete, P, NP, polynomial time).

error_codes.name: Hidden exponential step
error_codes.description: Algorithm claimed polynomial includes an implicit exponential search or branching.

error_codes.name: Circular reasoning
error_codes.description: The argument assumes what it tries to prove.

error_codes.name: Model shift
error_codes.description: Changes computational model or assumptions without explicitly stating it.

error_codes.name: Informal leap
error_codes.description: Argument becomes hand-wavy or heuristic without a valid formal step.
